@description.name: @description
@description.body: Table Row renderer for Progressive.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
columnWidths {qx.ui.progressive.renderer.table.Widths}
   Information that indicates how to resize each of the column widths
@param.description: Information that indicates how to resize each of the column widths

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Storage for each progressive.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Default row padding.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: modify padding parameter below too if this changes

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Default style sheet for table cells.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The default height of a row, if not altered by a cell renderer.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper to link the theme colors to the current class

@description.name: @description
@description.body: overridden

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
progressive {qx.ui.progressive.Progressive}
   The Progressive object to which we are being joined.
@param.description: The Progressive object to which we are being joined.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
name {String}
   The name by which the data model will reference this renderer.  This
   is important to know in order to access the appropriate member of the
   {@link qx.ui.progressive.State}'s renderer array.  That array is
   accessed from the renderer by
   state.getRendererData()[element.renderer] where element.renderer will
   be the name provided here.
@param.description:
The name by which the data model will reference this renderer.  This
   is important to know in order to access the appropriate member of the
   {@link qx.ui.progressive.State}'s renderer array.  That array is
   accessed from the renderer by
   state.getRendererData()[element.renderer] where element.renderer will
   be the name provided here.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add a cell renderer for use within a row rendered by this row renderer.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
column {Integer}
   The column number for which the cell renderer applies
@param.description: The column number for which the cell renderer applies

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
renderer {qx.ui.progressive.renderer.table.cell.Abstract}
   The cell renderer for the specified column.
@param.description: The cell renderer for the specified column.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove a cell renderer previously added with {@link #addRenderer}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
column {Integer}
   The column for which the cell renderer is to be removed.
@param.description: The column for which the cell renderer is to be removed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: overridden

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
state {qx.ui.progressive.State}
   Data relevant to the current rendering session.
@param.description: Data relevant to the current rendering session.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
element {Object}
   An object containing at least the following members:
   <dl>
     <dt>
       renderer</dt>
     <dd>
       The name of a renderer.  That name is used by {@link
       qx.ui.progressive.Progressive} to select the renderer to be used
       to render this element.  The name should match one provided to
       {@link qx.ui.progressive.Progressive#addRenderer}.
     </dd>
     <dt>
       data
     </dt>
     <dd>
       The data to be passed to the renderer.  The data may be of any
       type that the renderer knows how to render.
     </dd>
   </dl>
@param.description:
An object containing at least the following members:
   <dl>
     <dt>
       renderer</dt>
     <dd>
       The name of a renderer.  That name is used by {@link
       qx.ui.progressive.Progressive} to select the renderer to be used
       to render this element.  The name should match one provided to
       {@link qx.ui.progressive.Progressive#addRenderer}.
     </dd>
     <dt>
       data
     </dt>
     <dd>
       The data to be passed to the renderer.  The data may be of any
       type that the renderer knows how to render.
     </dd>
   </dl>

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This method is required by the box layout. If returns an array of items to relayout.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event handler for the "resize" event. We recalculate the widths of each of the columns, and modify the stylesheet rule applicable to each column, to apply the new widths.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property defaultRowHeight. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #defaultRowHeight}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property defaultRowHeight. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #defaultRowHeight}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property defaultRowHeight. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #defaultRowHeight}.
